resources.string:
The Network Survey app requires a few permissions to work. Denying these permissions will result in the app not functioning properly. 

1. Make and Manage Phone Calls: This app does not make or manage phone calls. Instead, it needs this permission to get access to the current cellular connection type (e.g. LTE vs UMTS). 

2. Access this Device's Location: This app creates a log file which includes the location the cellular record was captured at and to display GNSS details. 

3. Access Photos, Media, and Files on Your Device: This permission allows the log file to be written.
You can choose how you want to get notified, when an IMSI catcher is detected.
You can choose how you want to get notified, when a SMS/SS7 attack is detected.
Please grant ALL requested permissions to run an Active network Test.
You have to grant ALL requested permissions to be able to run an Active network Test with SnoopSnitch
Please grant ALL requested permissions to enable running SnoopSnitch\'s background service.
You have to grant ALL requested permissions to enable SnoopSnitch\'s background service.
Please grant the access to the storage for PCAP exports.
You have to grant access to the storage to use the PCAP export feature.
You have not granted the access to the location information, so Recording will not be possible.
Please grant ALL requested information, to get all available Network
You have to grant ALL requested permissions, to get further Network information.
Creating Database failed. Please remove the App data in the Android App settings and restart SnoopSnitch. If this does not solve the problem, please reinstall SnoopSnitch.
Your device does not have a MSM Qualcomm chip, and is therefore not able to run SnoopSnitch main features.
Your device is not compatible currently. This might change with an upcoming firmware update.
Main and network security test notifications
SnoopSnitch\'s network scan will not work properly.
Network test and attack detection require root.
Device /dev/diag does not exist: No Qualcomm chipset or unsuitable firmware.
Your device is not properly rooted (su binary does not work).
Your device is not rooted (no su binary found).
Root access denied by su. Check permissions.
Error, no baseband messages received during active network test.
SnoopSnitch was not able to parse baseband messages, during the last run.\nIt might be that your device is not compatible,\n and therefore the main features of SnoopSnitch will not work properly.
